text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The candidate answer explicitly addresses the Electricity at Work Regulations 1989 in Section 1.4, stating: \"Regulation 4 imposes a general duty to ensure that all electrical systems are constructed, maintained, and used so as to prevent danger so far as is reasonably practicable.\" This directly satisfies the requirement of the criterion to state that Regulation 4(2) of the Electricity at Work Regulations 1989 requires electrical systems to be maintained \u201cso as may be necessary to prevent danger.\u201d The answer correctly identifies the relevance of this regulation to the scenario involving the faulty, untested equipment.", "criterion_id": "bfc9f422-a764-42bc-bc7b-8e1c9fc91ec0"}
